name: Dhokla
history: Dhokla is a vegetarian food item that originates from the Indian state of Gujarat. It's made with a fermented batter derived from rice and split chickpeas.
description: Dhokla is a light and spongy steamed cake made from rice and chickpea flour. It's a popular Gujarati snack, known for its tangy and sweet taste.

equipment.name: steamer
equipment.description: A kitchen appliance used to cook or prepare various foods with steam heat.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: A bowl used for mixing ingredients.

equipment.name: spatula
equipment.description: A broad, flat, flexible blade used to mix, spread, and lift material.

instructions.title: Prepare Batter
instructions.description: Mix gram flour, yogurt, lemon juice, green chili-ginger paste, turmeric, salt, and water to form a smooth batter. Let it ferment for 4-5 hours.

instructions.title: Steam Dhokla
instructions.description: Just before steaming, add baking soda to the batter and pour it into a greased plate. Steam for about 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

instructions.title: Prepare Tempering
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, sesame seeds, and curry leaves. Once they crackle, add water and sugar. Bring it to a boil and then pour it over the steamed Dhokla.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Cut Dhokla into pieces and serve with green chutney.

tips: Ensure the batter is fermented well to achieve the right texture.
Adding fruit salt or baking soda just before steaming will help make the Dhokla fluffy.
variations: Add finely chopped spinach or coriander to the batter for a different flavor.
Use a mixture of semolina and gram flour for a different texture.

storage.shelfLife: Dhokla can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or steam for a few minutes.
presentationTips: Garnish with grated coconut and chopped coriander for a fresh look.
